title: Shap interaction with XGBoost with interventional feature pertubation not supported?
body:
I am trying to get shap_interaction values through XGBoost, and I wonder if interventional feature pertubation is not supported but it is still silently giving the zero matrix? Looking at the shap code, it looks like line 463

`assert self.feature_perturbation == "tree_path_dependent", "Only feature_perturbation = \"tree_path_dependent\" is supported for SHAP interaction values right now!"`

in https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/master/shap/explainers/_tree.py is commented out. 

As a reproducer, we start after line [5] in https://shap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/example_notebooks/tabular_examples/tree_based_models/Basic%20SHAP%20Interaction%20Value%20Example%20in%20XGBoost.html, which fixes the X matrix and model class instance.

Then, if instead of following the tutorial, I run

`explainer_marginal = shap.TreeExplainer(model, data=X)`
`shap_values_marginal = explainer_marginal.shap_values(X)`
`shap_interaction_values = explainer_marginal.shap_interaction_values(X)`

and get the zero matrix for shap_interaction_values. Thanks in advance and do let me know if I'm being silly in some way!
